data.title: Robert White (abt.1455-bef.1512)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Robert White born abt. 1455 Hampshire, England died 1512 England including ancestors + descendants + 3 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 27 Dec 2022 | Created 19 Oct 2010

This page has been accessed 8,633 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Research Notes

2.1 Unsourced Children

3 Sources

4 Acknowledgements

4.1 Magna Carta Project

Biography

Robert White, son and heir of John White (or Whyte), Gent., and Eleanor Hungerford,[1][2] was born about 1455 (aged 14 at his father's death in 1469).[3] He was likely born in Hampshire, where his father held lands in both Binsted and Milford.

His wardship was granted in 1469 to Thomas St. Leger, esquire of the body, and Nicholas Gainsford, Esq. He was granted license to enter his father's lands 24 February 1481.[4] Robert inherited lands in Hampshire, including Milford.[5]

Robert served as commissioner of array for Hampshire in 1511.[4]

Robert married Margaret Gainsford,[3] daughter of Nicholas Gainsford and Margaret Sidney.[1] They had two sons and three daughters:

Robert,[1] married Elizabeth Inglefeld and had issue[3][6]

Henry,[1] married Elizabeth Fenrother and had issue[3]

Margaret, wife of John Kirton, Esq.[1][3]

_______, wife of Peter Cowdrey[1][3]

Anne, wife of Nicholas Tichborne[1][3]

In 1483, King Edward V charged Robert to prepare for knighthood at Edward V's coronation, but the ceremony never took place.[1][7][4]

According to Richardson, Robert died shortly before November 1512,[1] when livery of his lands was given to his son and heir, Robert.[4]

Research Notes

Unsourced Children

There are no sources to support a child named Mary White, her profile was detached as a child of Robert and Margaret.

Sources

↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 1.6 1.7 1.8 Douglas Richardson. Royal Ancestry: A Study in Colonial and Medieval Families, 5 vols., ed. Kimball G. Everingham. (Salt Lake City, UT: the author, 2013), vol. III, page 447, KIRTON 14: Robert White.

↑ Douglas Richardson. Magna Carta Ancestry: A Study in Colonial and Medieval Families, 4 vols., ed. Kimball G. Everingham. 2nd edition. (Salt Lake City, UT: the author, 2011), vol. II, pages 502-503, KIRTON 11. Google Books.

↑ 3.0 3.1 3.2 3.3 3.4 3.5 3.6 Thomas Benolt. Pedigrees from the Visitations of Hampshire. HSP v.64. 1913, pp. 81-82: White. Archive.org.

↑ 4.0 4.1 4.2 4.3 Douglas Richardson. "Plantagenet Ancestry of Edward Rainsford" in the New England Historical and Genealogical Register. Boston: NEHGS, Vol. 154 (2000), pp. 224-225.

↑ William Page, ed. "Parishes: Milford" in A History of the County of Hampshire. Vol. 5. London, 1912, pp. 115-124. British History Online.

↑ William Berry. County Genealogies: Pedigrees of the Families In the County of Hants. London: Sherwood, Gilbert, and Piper, 1833, p. 241-242. HathiTrust.

↑ W.A. Shaw. The Knights of England. London: Sherratt and Hughes, 1906, p. 140. Archive.org

Possible probate (index only) - more research needed: "UK, Extracted Probate Records, 1269-1975". Book: Calendar of Wills and Administrations now preserved in the Probate Registry at Canterbury, 1396-1558 (Will). Ancestry Record 1610 #527032 ($). White Whyte, Robert probate.

The National Archives. Discovery: Several interrelated cases filed together, including Whyte v Newbrugge. C 1/52/43

Calendar of the patent rolls preserved in the Public record office: 1476-1485. 1901, page 237. HathiTrust

Hasted, Edward. The History and Topographical Survey of the County of Kent. Volume 10. Canterbury: 1800, pp. 126-137, 250, 383. British History Online.

The National Archives Discovery: Inquisition Post Mortem of his father, John. C 140/32/25.

Lewis, Marlyn. Robert White, Gent. entry in Our Royal Titled Noble and Commoner Ancestors online database.

"England & Wales, Prerogative Court of Canterbury Wills, 1384-1858". The National Archives; Kew, Surrey, England; Records of the Prerogative Court of Canterbury, Series PROB 11; Class: PROB 11; Piece: 5. Ancestry Sharing Link (free access); Ancestry Record 5111 #884072 ($). Named in the will of his grandfather, Roberti White, granted probate on 14 Nov 1467.

Acknowledgements

Magna Carta Project

This profile was developed for the Magna Carta Project on 27 June 2022 by Thiessen-117 and reviewed for the Project the same day by Michael Cayley.

Robert White is named in a Richardson-documented trail from Gateway Ancestor George Yate to Magna Carta Surety Baron Robert de Vere (Magna Carta Ancestry, vol. IV, pages 395-397 YATE) and the Magna Carta Project identified an additional trail to Saher de Quincy. These trails were badged in July 2022 and are set out in the Magna Carta Trails section of the Gateway's profile.

Robert White appears in Magna Carta Ancestry in a Richardson-documented trail from Gateway Ancestor Edward Raynsford to Magna Carta Surety Baron Robert de Vere (vol. II, pages 501-504 KIRTON) that has not yet been developed by the Magna Carta Project. The trail is are set out in the Magna Carta Trails section of the Gateway's profile.

See Base Camp for more information about identified Magna Carta trails and their status. See the project's glossary for project-specific terms, such as a "badged trail".
